abstract: Scott Jurek, ultramarathon runner who set record for hiking Appalachian Trail in 46 days, agrees to pay $500 fine for public drinking at trail's end in exchange for state of Maine dropping littering charge.
lead_paragraph: Scott Jurek, the ultramarathon runner who set a speed record for hiking the Appalachian Trail in 46 days, agreed to pay a $500 fine for public drinking at the trail’s terminus on Mount Katahdin.

headline.main: Maine: Speedy Hiker Will Pay Fine After Champagne Celebration
headline.print_headline: Maine: Speedy Hiker Will Pay Fine After Champagne Celebration

snippet: Scott Jurek, the ultramarathon runner who set a speed record for hiking the Appalachian Trail in 46 days, agreed to pay a $500 fine for public drinking at the trail’s terminus on Mount Katahdin.
